title: Mahindra XUV 3XO receives first price hike
description: Mahindra has increased the prices of the XUV 3XO by up to Rs 30,000, depending on the variant. Launched in April this year, the XUV 3XO is now priced from Rs 7.79 lakh to Rs 14.99 lakh. The AX5 petrol variants have received a price hike of Rs 30,000, while the diesel version now costs Rs 10,000 more. The AX5 L variant, available with the sole 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo-petrol motor is now Rs 25,000 costlier for both manual and automatic options. The price hike goes up to Rs 30,000, depending on the variant and powertrain.

Mahindra has increased the prices of the XUV 3XO by up to Rs 30,000, depending on the variant. Launched in April this year, the XUV 3XO is now priced from Rs 7.79 lakh to Rs 14.99 lakh.

Mahindra XUV 3XO: new prices

The entry-level MX1 variant’s price has been increased by Rs 30,000, while prices of the MX2 Pro variants have been hiked by Rs 25,000. The MX3 trim levels are now Rs 25,000 costlier with the petrol powertrain options, while MX3 diesel prices are up by Rs 10,000. The MX3 Pro’s prices remain unchanged.

The AX5 petrol variants have received a price hike of Rs 30,000, while the diesel version now costs Rs 10,000 more. The AX5 L variant, available with the sole 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo-petrol motor is now Rs 25,000 costlier for both manual and automatic options. The prices for the top-end AX7 and AX7 L trims remain the same as before.

Mahindra XUV 3XO: powertrains, rivals

Powertrain options on offer with the XUV 3XO include a 111hp, 1.2-litre turbo-petrol motor, a 131hp, 1.2-litre direct-injection turbo-petrol unit, and a 117hp, 1.5-litre diesel engine. A 6-speed manual gearbox is standard across all three. The diesel gets an optional 6-speed AMT, while the petrol engines are available with an optional 6-speed torque converter automatic.

XUV 3XO faces competition from the likes of Tata Nexon, Kia Seltos, Hyundai Venue, Maruti Brezza, among other similarly priced SUVs.
